column4: there is also readom, http://pthree.org/2011/09/26/how-to-properly-create-and-burn-cddvd-iso-images-from-the-command-line/ (haven't tried it but thought it was an interesting article)
bug 781931 looks like it should be fixed in 5.14.0
looks like I'm on 5.12. Does apt-get upgrade && apt-get dist-upgrade not update me to Unity 5.14?
5.14.0 isn't released yet, but actually on closer reading of the comments it might not, since the proposed fix is against gtk+ (and from a while ago)
then I wonder how my other laptop doesn't have this issue whatsoever...
don't know, I can reproduce it here on this netbook though
oh, so you're seeing the exact same thing?
I'm getting in the habit of hitting alt tab whenever I type in an application I want to open. Shouldn't need to do that, but it's nice to see it's not JUST me. :P
if this is < 12.10, you will need and updated version of babl and gegl too
since 2.8 isn't in the repos, and we don't want PPAs to manage, I got the .deb's for 2.8 so I'm trying to figure out how to install them manually sow e can later automate it
yes that is fine, you'll just need those too
I suppose the .deb's wouldn't take care of that?
the newer versions are not in the repo (until 12.10), so you'd need to find them, think you'll just need libbabl-0.1-0 and libgegl-0.2-0
appreciate it - looking into those packages now!
gnome-terminal --full-screen -e command; though there is also: gnome-terminal --maximize -e command; if that's what you meant
